content.raw:
This tutorial is a little different from our other tutorials. For example, instead of explaining how to use the feature, it describes the source code behind it.

Also, since there is already a Hydra support in Gazebo, users could be confused as to what they should use, and when. Can you explain in more depth:

* The differences between the 2 approaches

* What the tutorial actually demoes (it publishes hydra messages).

* Users also need to know there should be a server plugin to handle these messages.
content.html:
This tutorial is a little different from our other tutorials. For example, instead of explaining how to use the feature, it describes the source code behind it.

Also, since there is already a Hydra support in Gazebo, users could be confused as to what they should use, and when. Can you explain in more depth:

  • The differences between the 2 approaches

  • What the tutorial actually demoes (it publishes hydra messages).

  • Users also need to know there should be a server plugin to handle these messages.
